title: Chrissy Teigen mercilessly teases husband John Legend after THAT awkward La La Land Oscars blunder
text:
Chrissy Teigen mercilessly teases husband John Legend after THAT awkward La La Land Oscars blunder The singer thought he'd won Best Picture with La La Land Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Chrissy Teigen teases John Legend over lack of Oscar this year Share this video   
Chrissy Teigen has got a wicked sense of humour - and luckily her husband John Legend does too. 
So when she gave him a ribbing for not winning an Oscar for LaLa Land, he didn't seem to mind. 
The couple were in a car driving in Hollywood when a tour bus went by. 
"It's John Legend, he won an Oscar," Chrissy shouted through the open window. "Not this year though." John Legend shouts at a passing tour bus (Photo: Twitter/christine teigen) Fans were thrilled to catch a glimpse of the star (Photo: Twitter/christine teigen) 
John agreed: "Not this year." 
Yesterday, the singer looked absolutely devastated after finding out that La La Land hadn't actually won Best Picture at the Oscars . 
The All Of Me hitmaker joined his fellow stars, including Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling, and creatives behind the film on stage at the 89th Academy Awards after the musical was announced as the winner. 
Hollywood legends Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway named La La Land, when it was actually Moonlight which took the top prize home. Read More You had ONE job! Guardians of Oscars winners pictured ahead of blunder, as mystery of THAT double envelope is revealed John looked pretty upset when the mistake was pointed out (Photo: Rex Features) 
It was a painfully awkward moment that will go down in history as one of the biggest ever Oscars gaffes - along with the time John Travolta called Idina Menzel 'Adele Dazeem' when introducing her on stage. 
The 'winners' had begun making their emotional acceptance speeches when it was announced that there had been a mistake. 
John, who played Keith in the film, can be seen in the background when the news breaks, looking pretty upset about it all. 
John already has one Oscar in his collection, after taking home the Best Original Song gong for Glory - written with Common for the film Selma - in 2014. He looks gutted (Photo: yesalexkim/Twitter) 
But another one would have been extra nice, we're sure. 
Viewers immediately started speculating exactly how it happened, with some believing the presenters were handed the wrong card by producers. 
Some thought they were actually holding the card that announced Emma Stone as the winner of Best Actress in a Leading Role for La La Land, and therefore read out that film by mistake. 
But Emma has revealed that that couldn't possibly be the case. 
Holding her Best Actress award, Emma spoke out backstage. Read More John was at the ceremony with his wife Chrissy Teigen (Photo: WireImage) Read More
